intro: Hedythyrsus katangensis var. katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga hedythyrsus, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are often hairy. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
